p: The composition of Z. tenuior essential oil may therefore vary with plant genetics, environmental conditions, extraction methods, and geographic origin, including climate, soil, elevation, and topography. The main components of Z. tenuior, which are identified by GC/MS analysis of the extracts, are 53.977% of p-menth-3-en-8-ol, 38.481% of pulegone, and 1.651% of p-menth-3,8-diene. The essential oil also contained smaller percentages of β-pinene; 4a α-, 7 α-, and 7a α-nepetalactone; α-thujene; caryophyllene oxide; limonene; E-caryophyllene; and terpinolene. p-Menth-3-en-8-ol and pulegone are the main components of Z. tenuior, and they are responsible for the antimicrobial activities of the essential oil [ 275]. Essential oils of Z. tenuior aerial parts were characterized by high levels of oxygenated monoterpenes, especially pulegone [ 276].
